recipeText:
Heat oven to 350° F. Heat biscuits from "can" 8 min. or til slightly brown.

Serve with butter & jelly or honey.

ingredientList:
6 apples, peeled and sliced
   3/4 cup sugar
   2 tablespoons flour
   1 teaspoon vanilla extract
   1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
   1 dash nutmeg
   1 dash salt
   2 tablespoons butter
recipeText:
Mix all ingredients & pour into unbaked pastry shell.

Bake at 350° for 45 minutes or til done.

ingredientList:
1/4 cup Tang or other mix
   2 tablespoons sugar
   1 cup water
   1/2 cup milk
   1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
   2 cups crushed ice
recipeText:
Mix ingredients and blend.

To crush ice, wrap in towel and hammer.

Can mix with fresh fruit.

recipeName: 3-2-1 RIBS: Perfect Fall Off The Bone Ribs
recipeDescription: Ken has used this recipe multiple times. Excellent!
ingredientList:
1 rack pork baby back ribs
2 tablespoons Best Dry Rub for Ribs (See separate recipe)
1 cup apple cider or apple juice
1/4 cup dark brown sugar
2 - 3 tablespoons salted butter
1/2 cup BBQ Sauce
recipeText:
1) Begin by removing the membrane on the back of the ribs.

2) Liberally season both sides of the ribs using the dry rub, starting with the bone side.

3) Prepare your smoker for indirect smoking. Target temperature is between 180-200 with thin blue smoke.
Place the seasoned ribs on the smoker and close the lid. Leave them to smoke for 3 hours.

4) Tear off a large piece of aluminum foil and place it on a large working surface.
Transfer the ribs to the foil bone side up so the bones don't tear through the foil.
Sprinkle with the brown sugar, top with the butter cut into small pads, and then pour over the apple cider.

5) Tightly crimp the foil together to create an airtight seal.
Return to the grill and increase your cooking temperature to as close to 225 degrees as you can get it.
Let the ribs braise for 2 hours in the foil.

6) Carefully remove the ribs from the grill and place on a large working surface.
Open the foil package (be careful of hot steam) and use tongs to remove the ribs and place them back on the grill, bone side down.
Discard the foil and excess cooking liquid.

7) Brush the ribs with your favorite BBQ sauce, close the lid of your grill and cook at 225 degrees for an additional hour
until the ribs are done to your desired tenderness and the sauce is sticky and set.

ingredientList:
1/2 pound sausage
1/2 pound ground beef
1 clove minced garlic
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup wine
1 32-ounce jar spaghetti sauce
1 8-ounce can tomato sauce
1 pound package lasagna noodles
2 eggs, beaten
2 cups cottage cheese or ricotta cheese
1/2 cup grated american cheese
1 pound cheddar or mozzarella cheese, grated
1 teaspoon parsley
Dash pepper
recipeText:
Brown meat. Drain off fat. Add garlic, salt, wine; simmer 3 minutes.

Add spaghetti sauce and tomato sauce. Cook 10 minutes.

Meanwhile, boil lasagna noodles.

Combine eggs, all cheeses, parsley, and pepper.

In flat, greased pan, arrange meat cause, lasagna, & cheese layers; repeat til you finish with meat sauce.

Bake 350° for 30 minutes.

ingredientList:
Grease skillet; sprinkle salt on it; heat skillet in oven while mixing cornbread according to package directions.

(Make it "thinner" by adding a little milk.)

Heat cornbread in skillet 20 min at 350°/400° Spread butter on it.

Cut in slices and remove from skillet with spatula to avoid crumbling.

Serve with beans, bacon, sausage, or ham.

Good with chili on it.

recipeText:
Slice 1 peeled cucumber.

Add chopped tomato (1 or 2), 1/4 cup onion, and a little bell pepper.

Season with 1/3 cup vinegar, 1/3 cup canned milk, and 1 tablespoon bacon chips.

Mix and chill til served.

Fry bacon on medium hot skillet til crisp; drain.

Put on bread or toast; use mayonnaise, lettuce, and tomato.

Good with chips.

ingredientList:
4 large potatoes
Worcestershire sauce
Butter
recipeText:
Scrub potatoes; put butter and worcestershire sauce on potatoes. Wrap in foil.

Bake at 400° - 450° about 1 hour til potatoes feel soft when stuck with a fork.

Serve with butter, sour cream, cheese, bacon crisps.

Good with ham or barbequed chips.

recipeDescription: Ken likes them so much, he thinks we could sell them.
ingredientList:
2 chicken breasts
1 tablespoon Southwest Chipotle Seasoning
1 can black beans
1 Pepper Jack Cheese Dip Recipe
1 lettuce
1 salsa
1 sour cream
1 shredded cheddar or colby-jack cheese
1 pickled jalapeno pepper
1 Dorito or Tostito Chips
1 avocado
recipeText:
Season chicken with Southwest Chipotle Seasoning. Cook throughly and cut into small cubes.
Make Pepper Jack Cheese Dip recipe. Make guacamole using avocado, a bit of salsa, and salt.
Make nachos using all above ingredients.

recipeDescription: From May Carol, the best elementary school cook ever!
ingredientList:
18 ounces semisweet chocolate chips
3/4 cup peanut butter
3 cups peanuts
2 cups miniature marshmallows
recipeText:
Melt chocolate chips. Add peanut butter. Stir in peanuts & marshmallows. Place in 9" X 13" pan and let cool.

(alternate: use 12 oz chocolate chips and 6 - 12 oz butterscotch chips.)

ingredientList:
3 ounces dark rum
1 1/2 ounces coffee liqueur
1/2 ounce white creme de cacao
Crushed ice
1 cup ice cream
1/8 cup milk
recipeText: Mix, serve.

ingredientList:
2 cups cubed bread
1 teaspoon minced garlic
1 teaspoon oregano
1 teaspoon Italian seasoning
1/2 cup melted butter
recipeText: Melt butter. Add seasoning and stir in bread. Place on flat cookie sheet. Bake at 400° for 5 - 8 minutes.

ingredientList: Bacon
recipeText:
Preheat your oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit.

Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper. (Optional, I don't do this so I can save the grease.)

Lay the bacon slices on the baking sheet.

Cook the bacon for 18-20 minutes or until it’s as crispy as you’d like.

Remove the bacon from the oven and transfer to a paper towel-lined plate.

ingredientList:
3 cups all-purpose flour
1 tablespoon baking powder
2 cups plus 5 tablespoons sugar, divided
1 cup vegetable oil
4 eggs
1/3 cup orange juice
1/2 teaspoon salt
2-1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract
4 medium tart apples, peeled and thinly sliced
2 teaspoons ground cinnamon (I add extra for better flavor)
Confectioners' sugar, optional
recipeText:
In a mixing bowl, combine flour, baking powder, 2 cups sugar, oil, eggs, orange juice, salt and vanilla. Beat until thoroughly combined. 

In another bowl, toss apples with cinnamon and 5 tablespoons of sugar. Spread one-third of batter in a greased, floured 10-in. tube pan. Cover with half of the apples. Repeat layers. Spoon remaining batter over top. 

Bake at 350° for 1 hour and 30 minutes or until cake tests done. 

Cool in pan for 20 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely. Just before serving, dust with confectioners' sugar if desired.

chapterName: Candy, Treats, and other Odds & Ends
ingredientList:
1 tablespoon lemon juice (or white vinegar)
1 cup milk
recipeText:
1. Place a Tablespoon of lemon juice or white vinegar in a liquid measuring cup.
2. Add enough milk to bring the liquid up to the one-cup line.
3. Let stand for five minute. Then, use as much as your recipe calls for.

For 1/3 cup buttermilk, put 1 teaspoon of lemon juice in a 1/3 cup measuring cup and top with milk.

ingredientList:
4 chicken breasts
1 seasoning as desired
recipeText:
Season chicken and place in glass pan. Cover lightly with aluminum foil.

Bake at 425° for 18 - 25 minutes.

ingredientList:
1 1/2 cups flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon salt
1 cup margarine
3/4 cup brown sugar
3/4 cup sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
2 eggs
1 tablespoon hot water
1 package semi-sweet chocolate chips
2 cups rolled oats
recipeText:
Mix all ingredients, except chocolate chips and oats, together. When mixture forms a dough, add chocolate chips and oats.

Drop on greased cookie sheet and bake at 350° for 8 to 10 minutes.

ingredientList:
1 stick margarine
1 cup flour
1/2 cup sugar
1/2 cup brown sugar
Apple slices
Cinnamon
recipeText:
Line a 9" x 9" x 2" cake pan with apple slices.

Mix margarine, flour, and sugar. (Can use 1 cup of sugar instead of 1/2 of each brown and regular sugar.)

Crumble mixture over the apples, and sprinkle with cinnamon. Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.

recipeDescription: Ken only wants to eat this 2 times per year.
ingredientList:
Delta Pride catfish fillets
Onion & chives dressing
Seasoning salt
Potato chips (crushed very fine)
Grated cheddar cheese
recipeText:
Coat or marinate catfish fillets in dressing (Hidden Valley Ranch is also good). Grease or Pam your baking sheet as cheese will stick.

Sprinkle fillets with seasoning salt and bake for about 10 minutes. Pour off excess liquid.

Sprinkle crushed potato chips and grated cheese on fillets and bake at 400° F for 10 more minutes.

ingredientList:
2 1/2 tablespoons butter
3 1/2 tablespoons brown sugar
1 1/2 tablespoons water
3/4 cup powdered sugar
1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract
recipeText: Mix together.

ingredientList:
2 teaspoons butter
1 cup onions
1 1/2 cups diced celery
2 pounds ground beef
1 tablespoon mustard
1/2 cup water
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon pepper
1 teaspoon chili powder
1 1/2 tablespoons vinegar
3 tablespoons sugar
1 bottle (small) ketchup
recipeText: Brown beef and drain grease. Mix all ingredients together and simmer.

ingredientList:
2 large bananas
1 1/2 cups almond milk
1/2 cup vanilla yogurt
1 teaspoon honey
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 dash nutmeg
2 cups ice
recipeText: Blend until smooth. For a nicer consistency, freeze bananas and use less ice.

recipeDescription: Prep Time: 35 minutes (ready in 1 hour 10 minutes)
ingredientList:
1/4 cup butter, softened
2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley
1 tablespoon chopped green onions
1 teaspoon chopped fresh rosemary or 1/2 teaspoon dried rosemary leaves
1/4 teaspoon salt
dash pepper
2 garlic cloves, minced
4 boneless skinless chicken breast halves
1/4 cup all-purpose flour
1/4 cup unseasoned dry bread crumbs
1 egg
paprika
Nonstick cooking spray
recipeText:
1. In small bowl, combine butter, parsley, onions, rosemary, salt, pepper and garlic mix well. Shape mixture into 3-inch log refrigerate until firm.

2. Heat oven to 350°F. Place 1 chicken breast half, boned side up, between 2 pieces of plastic wrap or waxed paper. Working from center, gently pound chicken with flat side of meat mallet or rolling pin until about 1/8 to 1/4 inch thick remove wrap. Repeat with remaining chicken breast halves.

3. Cut butter log crosswise into 4 equal pieces. Place 1 piece of butter on each chicken breast half. Fold in sides roll up jelly-roll fashion, pressing ends to seal. If necessary, secure with toothpicks.

4. Place flour and bread crumbs in separate shallow bowls. Place egg in another shallow bowl beat well. Coat chicken with flour dip in beaten egg. Roll chicken in bread crumbs place in ungreased 8-inch square (2-quart) baking dish. Sprinkle with paprika. Spray chicken rolls with nonstick cooking spray.

5. Bake at 350°F. for 30 to 35 minutes or until chicken is fork-tender and juices run clear.

ingredientList:
8 Roma (plum) tomatoes, diced
1/3 cup chopped fresh basil
1/4 cup shredded Parmesan cheese
2 cloves garlic, minced
1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar
1 teaspoon olive oil
1/4 teaspoon kosher salt
1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
1 loaf French bread, toasted and sliced
recipeText:
In a bowl, toss together the tomatoes, basil, Parmesan cheese, and garlic. Mix in the balsamic vinegar, olive oil, kosher salt, and pepper.

Let sit 1-2 hours in fridge before serving.

Serve on toasted bread slices.

recipeDescription:
Melissa really liked this. The boys were a bit turned off by the spinach.... even though they couldn't taste it!

Cooks in 30 minutes.
ingredientList:
1 1/2 pounds bonless, skinless chicken breasts, thinly sliced
2 tablespoons olive oil
1 cup heavy cream
1/2 cup chicken broth
1 teaspoon garlic powder
1 teaspoon Italian seasoning
1/2 cup Parmesan cheese
1 cup spinach, chopped. Can use frozen spinach.
1/2 cup sun dried tomatoes
1 box pasta noodles
recipeText:
In a large skillet add olive oil and cook the chicken on medium high heat for 3-5 minutes on each side or until brown on each side and cooked until no longer pink in center. Remove chicken and set aside on a plate.

Add the heavy cream, chicken broth, garlic powder, italian seasoning, and parmesan cheese. Whisk over medium high heat until it starts to thicken. Add the spinach and sundried tomatoes and let it simmer until the spinach starts to wilt. Add the chicken back to the pan.

Cook pasta according to directions. Mix chicken meal with pasta, or serve over the top. I like to thicken the sauce a bit with flour.

ingredientList:
4 eggs (yolks)
3/4 cup sugar
1 tablespoon unflavored jello (1 envelope)
1/4 cup water
1/4 cup green creme de menthe
5 drops green food coloring (optional)
1 1/2 cups heavy cream
1 box chocolate cookie crumb pie crust mix
1/3 cup melted butter
recipeText:
Separate eggs. Beat yolks and sugar until very thick. Dissolve gelatin in hot water for 5 minutes, then add to egg mixture. Stir in creme de menthe and food coloring. Set aside until the mixture begins to set.

Crush chocolate cookies (if not crushed) until fine. Stir in melted butter. Pat into pie shell and chill.

Whip cream until stiff, and fold into gelatin mixture. Pour into shell and set in refrigerator until firm.

ingredientList:
2 cups heavy whipping cream
1/8 cup sugar, to taste
4 apples
recipeText:
Whip cream in mixer using wire whip until stiff peaks form. Add sugar to taste.

Core; slice and dice apples. Mix into whipped cream.

Can also use sliced bananas or fruit cocktail.

recipeDescription:
Dylan didn't like these. Too spicy.
Kailey liked them the same as any scone.
Melissa thought they were okay. Better than some but not as good as others.
Ken liked them equally as well as others.
ingredientList:
2 3/4 cups all-purpose flour
1/3 cup granulated sugar
1 tablespoon baking powder
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
3/4 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
1 teaspoon ground ginger
1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
1/4 teaspoon ground allspice (or cardamom)
1 medium pear, peeled, cored, and diced
1/2 cup unsalted butter, cold and cut into pieces
1 tablespoon vanilla extract
1 cup buttermilk, cold (1 TBSP lemon juice or white distilled vinegar, and enough milk to make 1 cup)
1 tablespoon heavy cream
recipeText:
Make The Scones
In a large bowl, whisk the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, and cardamom together.

Cut the butter into the flour using a pastry blender, 2 knives, or your fingertips. The mixture should look like coarse crumbs. Gently fold in the pears.

Whisk the vanilla and buttermilk together and gradually add it to the flour mixture. Stir just until the dough comes together. You may not need all the buttermilk. Add a little at a time until the mixture is moist but not too wet. Do not over mix the dough or the scones will be tough.

Transfer the dough to a lightly floured surface and gently knead the dough four or five times. Pat the dough into a 7-inch round circle.

Cut the circle in half, then cut each half into four triangle-shaped wedges. Arrange the scones 2 inches apart on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Place the scones in the freezer for 30 minutes.

Position the oven rack in the center of the oven and heat to 400°F. Brush the tops of the scones with cream.

Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Transfer to a wire rack to cool and drizzle with glaze. Scones are best enjoyed right away.



Notes
Don't add all the liquid at once. Depending on the humidity and the brand of flour you are using, you may need less liquid than what is called for. Add just enough to moisten the dry ingredients until they hold together when squeezed.
Dice the pear into small pieces. Smaller pieces will make it easier to cut the dough into triangles.
Make sure butter and milk are cold when adding it to the recipe.
Freeze the shaped scones for 30 minutes before baking. This helps the scones keep their shape and ensures the butter isn't too warm before going into the oven.
This recipe yields 8 large scones. For smaller scones, cut the dough into 16 pieces instead of 8. Watch the scones closely as they bake because smaller scones may require a shorter baking time.
Make Ahead Tip
You can refrigerate the dough overnight then simply shape the scones and bake them the next day.
The dough can also be frozen for up to 2 months. Freeze the dough on a baking sheet as directed in step 5 then wrap in plastic wrap and store in a freezer bag. When ready to make the scones, preheat the oven and baked as directed. There's no need to thaw the dough.
You can keep leftover scones for up to 2 days in the refrigerator.
Unglazed scones can be frozen for up to three months. Thaw in the refrigerator overnight then reheat and glaze before serving.

Buttermilk is a favored product in high altitude baking because it contribute acidity as well as richness, moisture, flavor, and tenderness. If a sea-level recipe calls for regular milk, you can replace it with buttermilk. Acidity weakens the elasticity and/or strength of gluten in wheat flour, thereby keeping baked products tender.

recipeDescription:
Prep Time: Ready in 8 to 9 hours
Ken rating: Would eat 2 times per month
ingredientList:
8 pork chops
1/4 cup olive oil
1/4 teaspoon salt, to taste
1/4 teaspoon pepper, to taste
1 large onion, sliced 1/4-inch thick
2 cubes chicken bouillon
2 cups hot water
1 (8-ounce) package cream cheese
recipeText:
1. Season pork chops to taste.

2. Lightly brown pork chops in oil and place in crock-pot. Top pork chops with onion slices in the crock-pot.

3. Dissolve bouillon in hot water and pour over chops.

4. Cook on low 7 to 8 hours.

5. After the pork chops have cooked, stir cream cheese into the cooking juices. Turn crock-pot to high for about 30 minutes or until liquid is slightly thickened.

recipeDescription: This can be made with canned biscuits for dumplings, or with egg noodles for noodle soup.
ingredientList:
6 cups water
1 tbsp chicken bouillon paste (needs refrigeration after opening)
2 tablespoons butter
1 cup onion, diced
2 cloves garlic, minced (I usually leave this out)
1 cup celery, diced
1 cup carrot, diced
½ lb cooked chicken, shredded (I use canned chicken, drained)
2 cups egg noodles or 8 count roll of canned biscuits
1 teaspoon pepper
dried bay leaves - finely crushed
recipeText:
In a large pot, melt butter and add onions and garlic. Cook until onions have begun to soften. If you haven't cooked the chicken, cook it now (or use canned).

Add celery, carrots, and cooked shredded chicken.

Add water and add chicken bouillon to taste.

Add the egg noodles, salt, pepper, and bay leaves.

Bring to a boil and then reduce heat. If you are using biscuits, tear them in half, add to liquid, cover and simmer for 20 minutes.

Notes: You can used the granulated chicken bouillon, but the taste isn't as good and they are harder to dissolve.

recipeDescription: Our Favorite version is with the Air Fryer.
ingredientList:
1 pound Sweet Potatoes
1 tablespoon vegetable oil
1/4 teaspoon Garlic powder
1/3 teaspoon Salt
1/8 teaspoon Black Pepper
recipeText:
Peel and cube the sweet potatoes into 1/2 inch pieces.

Transfer the sweet potatoes to a bowl. Add the oil and seasonings. Toss them well, so they are all coated with the seasoning.

Preheat the air fryer to 400°F. Add the seasoned sweet potatoes to the air fryer and spread them in a single layer (cook in batches if needed).

Air fryer for 10-12 minutes for the perfect texture. Shake the basket at about 6 minutes.

To Roast In The Oven
Preheat the oven to 425°F. Transfer the seasoned sweet potatoes to a large sheet pan.
Spread evenly so they do not overlap. Cook for 25-30 minutes. Flip every 10-15 minutes for even cooking.

Notes
Do not overcrowd the air fryer. Cook in batches.
No need to boil them before roasting.
Serve them right away, they soften as they cool.

More seasoning options:
onion powder
cumin powder
red chili powder or paprika for a spicy version
curry powder for curry roasted sweet potatoes. Or add the basics such as turmeric, cumin, and garam masala.
Make them sweet by adding brown sugar, or maple syrup.
Add cinnamon and honey for a delicious holiday sweet potato side dish.
